definitions: relating to or supporting the policy of protecting the interests of native-born or established inhabitants against those of immigrants

examples.text: he has made his nativist beliefs known through his divisive comments about immigrants

shortDefinitions: relating to policy of protecting interests of native-born inhabitants

definitions: relating to or supporting the theory that concepts, mental capacities, and mental structures are innate rather than acquired by learning

examples.text: individual philosophers typically adopted either a nativist or empiricist position

shortDefinitions: relating to theory that concepts are innate rather than acquired

definitions: an advocate or supporter of nativist policies

examples.text: they have had to fend off suspicion and occasional hostility from nativists who see them as an unwelcome import

shortDefinitions: person who advocates protecting interests of native-born inhabitants

definitions: a person who advocates the theory that concepts, mental capacities, and mental structures are innate rather than acquired by learning

examples.text: extreme views were put forward by nativists on the one hand and by empiricists on the other

shortDefinitions: person who advocates theory that concepts are innate rather than acquired
